com.esri.mo2.client.io
Class Codecs

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.client.io.Codecs
public class Codecs
extends Object

This class supports static methods that are used to encrypt strings using 64-bit encoding. This form of encryption is used to authenticate user information.

A sample implementation of this class is shown below: 

 String content = _username + ":" + _password;

 _urlConn.setRequestProperty("Authorization", "Basic " + Codecs.base64Encode(content));

Method Summary

          This method decodes the given data using base64-encoding as specified in RFC-2045 (Section 6.8).

Method Detail

base64Encode

public static final String base64Encode(String str)
This method encodes the given string using base64-encoding as specified in RFC-2045 (Section 6.8). For example, it is used in Basic authentication.

Parameters:
str - the string to be encoded
Returns:
the encoded string

public static final byte[] base64Encode(byte[] data)
This method encodes the given data using base64-encoding as specified in RFC-2045 (Section 6.8).

Parameters:
data - the data to be encoded
Returns:
the base64-encoded data

public static final String base64Decode(String str)
This method decodes the given string using base64-encoding as specified in RFC-2045 (Section 6.8).

Parameters:
str - the base64-encoded string
Returns:
the decoded str
